definitions: To accept a responsibility or job.
To compete against someone or something.
To acquire a particular quality or appearance.
To allow passengers or cargo to board a vehicle.
examples: We decided to take on more staff.
She's going to take on the new project.
The team will take on their rivals next week.
The chameleon can take on the colors of its surroundings.
The bus will take on passengers at the next stop.
